Contributor.Organization: Centre for Molecular Biology and Neuroscience (CMBN) and Institute of Medical Microbiology

Platform.Title: Custom made Escherichia coli K12 MG1655 tiling array
Platform.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Platform.Catalog-Number: No catalog number as it is custom
Platform.Description: This is a custom made tiling array, with probes for almost all genes and all intergenic regions. Intergenic regions have much denser coverage than coding regions, and a uniform probe affinity has been strived after. The array design is described in Thomassen et al. (submitted) The genome used is:NC_000913

Column.Name: RANGE_START
Column.Description: Start coordinate of the probe sequence (see column SEQUENCE)

Column.Name: RANGE_END
Column.Description: End coordinate of the probe sequence (see column SEQUENCE)

Column.Name: RANGE_STRAND
Column.Description: Strand from which the probe sequence is derived (see column SEQUENCE)

Sample.Title: totRNA_MOCK_1

Channel.Source: total RNA extracted 20 min after mock treatment parallel to induction of the SOS response, unirradiated
Channel.Organism: Escherichia coli str. K-12 substr. MG1655
Channel.Treatment-Protocol: 50 ml culture of Escherichia coli K-12 MG1655 was treated as to be irradiated by UV 0 J/m2 OD600 = 0.5. The culture was further harvested by centrifugation 20 minutes after non-exposure to UV.(Samples 1-5)
Channel.Growth-Protocol: Escherichia coli K-12 MG1655 single colony from overnight cultures were diluted 1:500 in 100 ml K-medium (1xM9, 1.2% glucose, 1.25% casamino acids (dCAA), 1 mM MgSO4, 0.1 mM CaCl2) and grown at 37°C with aeration by rotary shaking until OD600=0.5.
Channel.Extract-Protocol: 1 ml trizol was added pr 106 cells and incubated at room temperature for 5 minutes. 0.2 ml chloroform was added pr ml Trizol and the sample was mixed for 15 seconds before 15 minutes centrifutgation (12000 g 4°C). The aqueous phase was slowly added 1:1(vol) to 70% EtOH and further loaded to a RNeasy column (QIAGEN), washed and DNase treated according to RNeasy protocol (QIAGEN).
Channel.Label: Biotin
Channel.Label-Protocol: Fragmented cDNA was terminal labelled with Biotin according to the Affymetrix 'Prokaryotic sample and array processing' protocol version 701029 Rev. 4.

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: Fragmented and labelled cDNA were hybridized to arrays overnight at 45°C according to the Affymetrix 'Prokaryotic sample and array processing' protocol version 701029 Rev. 4.
Sample.Scan-Protocol: The arrays were scanned using GeneChip Skanner 3000 7G with settings appropriate to the array type.
Sample.Description: single colony and culture parallell to totRNA_UV_1 (the culture was split in two, half induced by UV irradiation the other half as reference was not induced)
Sample.Data-Processing: Details on the analysis methods applied is found in the connected paper: Custom design and analysis of high-density oligonucleotide bacterial tiling microarrays. Thomassen GO, Rowe AD, Lagesen K, Lindvall JM, Rognes T. PLoS One. 2009 Jun 17;4(6):e5943. PMID: 19536279 Results of analysis of the reference dataset (the 5 MOCK E. coli arrays,) and the treated dataset (the 5 UV treated E. coli arrays) are provided in the "MOCKvsUVresults.tar" supplementary file available on the Series record.

Column.Name: VALUE
Column.Description: normalised, base-line shifted and in log2, values set to null have been removed

Series.Title: UV treated Escherichia coli reveals a high number of differentially expressed regions and many novel transcripts
Series.Summary:
The transcriptional changes in Escherichia coli upon induction of the SOS response are investigated by utilizing custom designed oligonucleotide microarrays.
Keywords: Gene expression during the SOS response in Escherichia coli
Series.Overall-Design: Escherichia coli K-12 MG1655 single colony in five parallells was grown to mid-log phase and exposed to UV to induce the SOS response. Total RNA was extracted from induced and uninduced cells and cDNA was prepared, fragmented and labelled prior to hybridizing to arrays. The arrays was designed to maximize the genomic coverage whilst simultaneous including only probes estimated to give an approximately uniform binding affinity. Regions coding for non-hypothetical proteins or RNAs where covered less densely than the intergenic parts.
Series.Type: Expression profiling by genome tiling array
